com.mesosphere.sdk.offer

Class ResourceUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mesosphere.sdk.offer.ResourceUtils

  • public final class ResourceUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    This class encapsulates common methods for scanning collections of Resources.

      • getAllResources

        public static java.util.List<Protos.Resource> getAllResources(java.util.Collection<Protos.TaskInfo> taskInfos)
        Returns a list of all the resources associated with one or more tasks, including Executor resources. The returned resources may contain duplicates if multiple tasks have copies of the same resource.

      • getAllResources

        public static java.util.List<Protos.Resource> getAllResources(Protos.TaskInfo taskInfo)
        Returns a list of all the resources associated with a task, including Executor resources.
        Parameters:
        taskInfo - The Protos.TaskInfo containing the Protos.Resource.
        Returns:
        a list of Protos.Resources.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • isProcessable

        public static boolean isProcessable(Protos.Resource resource,
                                    java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> ourRoles)
        Filter resources which are dynamically reserved against a role which isn't ours.

        We may receive resources with the following reservation semantics:

        • Dynamic against "our-role" or "pre-reserved-role/our-role" (belongs to us)
        • Static against "pre-reserved-role" (we can reserve against it)
        • Dynamic against "pre-reserved-role" (DOESN'T belong to us at all! Likely created by Marathon)

        This function should return false for all reservations of the last type.

        Parameters:
        resource - the resource to be examined
        ourRoles - the expected roles used by this framework, see also #getReservationRoles(org.apache.mesos.Protos.FrameworkInfo)
        Returns:
        whether this resource should be processed by our framework. if false then this resource should be ignored
